message.content:
<<<api>>>: SQLiteDatabase.query
<<<code>>>: private void showpins() {
    SQLiteDatabase db = mDbHelper.getReadableDatabase();
    Cursor mCursor = db.query(TABLE_NAME, null, null, null, null, null, null);
    startManagingCursor(mCursor);
    while (mCursor.moveToNext()) {
        Address = mCursor.getString(4);
        Name = mCursor.getString(0);
        String noSpaces = Address.replaceAll(" ", "+");
        JSONObject geocoded = getLocationInfo(noSpaces);
        GeoPoint point = getGeoPoint(geocoded);
        List<Overlay> mapOverlays = mapView.getOverlays();
        Drawable drawable = this.getResources().getDrawable(R.drawable.pushpin);
        CustomizedItemOverlay itemizedOverlay = new CustomizedItemOverlay(drawable, this);
        OverlayItem overlayitem = new OverlayItem(point, Name, Address);
        itemizedOverlay.addOverlay(overlayitem);
        mapOverlays.add(itemizedOverlay);
    }
}

<<<explanation>>>: To convert the method to an async method, you can use the `AsyncTask` class in Android. Here's an example of how you can modify the code:

private class ShowPinsTask extends AsyncTask<Void, Void, Void> {
    @Override
    protected Void doInBackground(Void... params) {
        SQLiteDatabase db = mDbHelper.getReadableDatabase();
        Cursor mCursor = db.query(TABLE_NAME, null, null, null, null, null, null);
        startManagingCursor(mCursor);
        while (mCursor.moveToNext()) {
            Address = mCursor.getString(4);
            Name = mCursor.getString(0);
            String noSpaces = Address.replaceAll(" ", "+");
            JSONObject geocoded = getLocationInfo(noSpaces);
            GeoPoint point = getGeoPoint(geocoded);
            List<Overlay> mapOverlays = mapView.getOverlays();
            Drawable drawable = YourActivity.this.getResources().getDrawable(R.drawable.pushpin);
            CustomizedItemOverlay itemizedOverlay = new CustomizedItemOverlay(drawable, YourActivity.this);
            OverlayItem overlayitem = new OverlayItem(point, Name, Address);
            itemizedOverlay.addOverlay(overlayitem);
            mapOverlays.add(itemizedOverlay);
        }
        return null;
    }

    @Override
    protected void onPostExecute(Void result) {
        // Update UI or perform any post-execution tasks here
    }
}

To execute the async task, you can call `new ShowPinsTask().execute();` in your activity. This will run the `doInBackground` method in a background thread, allowing the view to display instantly while the markers load.

Question: Help with Converting Method to Async Method: :I am trying to convert a method in my app to an async method. It is a method which loads a number of custom markers on Google Map view. I need to make this async so that the view displays instantly while the markers then load.Can anyone help give me some pointers on how I can convert the below method to an async method ? I am struggling to understand the concept. Thank you.private void showpins() throws IOException {    SQLiteDatabase db = mDbHelper.getReadableDatabase();    Cursor mCursor = db.query(TABLE_NAME, null, null, null, null, null, null);    startManagingCursor(mCursor);    while (mCursor.moveToNext()) {    Address = mCursor.getString(4);    Name = mCursor.getString(0);    String noSpaces = Address.replaceAll(" ", "+");    JSONObject geocoded = getLocationInfo(noSpaces);    GeoPoint point = getGeoPoint(geocoded);    List<Overlay> mapOverlays = mapView.getOverlays();    Drawable drawable = this.getResources().getDrawable(R.drawable.pushpin);    CustomizedItemOverlay itemizedOverlay =     new CustomizedItemOverlay(drawable, this);    OverlayItem overlayitem =     new OverlayItem(point, Name, Address);    itemizedOverlay.addOverlay(overlayitem);    mapOverlays.add(itemizedOverlay);    }}
Please using this api: SQLiteDatabase.query.
